history.content:
Lecture halls are pretty much always open until they get locked for the night. It's harder to find info about which halls are used for which classes. I might be wrong about this, but I believe you can search on the Class Schedule by the building you're looking for (e.g. "Dwinelle") and it will show you all the classes in that building, but not for specific room numbers (though there is probably somebody on campus you could email about that.)

You could also try and attend your virtual class in a quiet spot outside, in a library or study room, or a different free classroom in a nearby building.

children.subject: Pretty sure you can sit in the back few rows of Wheeler 150 and be doing anything on your computer, even if you aren't in the class currently using the lecture hall

history.content:
I don't know what it's going to be like in the fall with all of the restrictions, but the campus tries to keep the classrooms on campus full as much as possible throughout the day. Cory and Soda both open pretty early and close at 6:30 pm unless you have entry permission because you have a class with a lab. I've often been able to find empty rooms, though, by walking and looking. You just have to be flexible in case someone else walks in and needs the room.

+1 for Helix, though if I wound up in Econ 1 again, it might make me break out in a sweat. I have no mind for that.

For those of you who attended in-person classes, when do lecture halls open? Where can you find information about which halls are used for which classes? I am wondering if I can take my virtual class in the lecture hall of my next class.

Thanks!
history.subject: lecture hall opening
